## Purpose

This deck is designed to **exercise your custom Slide Viewer features** in one place:

-   Theme + typography + Nord-like styling
-   Overview/grid mode behavior
-   Progress bar behavior
-   Sidebar editor live-update behavior
-   Slide search behavior (content variety helps)
-   Markdown rendering coverage (tables, code, blockquotes, lists, inline formatting)
-   Smart video workflow (thumbnail-first, optional external open)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Keyboard + Click Navigation Test

Use these inputs and confirm they all work:

-   **Keyboard:** ← → ↑ ↓, Space
-   **Mouse:** next/prev arrows, slide stage click targets
-   **Touch:** fat-finger-friendly targets

Inline formatting sanity check: **bold**, *italics*, `inline code`, and a link to a harmless URL: <https://example.com>.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Overview Mode Test (Grid)

Trigger overview mode and confirm:

-   `O` key toggles overview
-   Grid icon toggles overview
-   Thumbnails render clearly (no missing styles)
-   Clicking a thumbnail jumps to that slide reliably

## Table Test (Nord Zebra)

| Feature Area | What to Look For | Pass Signal |
|------------------------|------------------------|------------------------|
| Header styling | Bold + distinct background | Header clearly separates from body |
| Zebra striping | Alternating row backgrounds | Easy row tracking |
| Cell padding | Comfortable spacing | No cramped text |
| Link rendering | Link contrast | Readable + obviously clickable |

## Code Block Test (Polar Night Container)

``` js
// Confirm: background, monospace font, padding, overflow handling
function clamp(n, min, max) {
  return Math.max(min, Math.min(max, n));
}

const progress = clamp(0.42, 0, 1);
console.log("progress:", progress);
```

Also confirm long-line behavior (horizontal scroll vs wrap):

``` txt
THIS_IS_A_SINGLE_VERY_LONG_LINE_DESIGNED_TO_TEST_OVERFLOW_HANDLING______________________________________________END
```
